docs.lead_paragraph: Hackers are putting top technology executives under severe pressure. And this week's sudden departure of Target's chief information officer in the wake of the company's massive pre-Christmas data breach has only ratcheted up the stress.

docs.lead_paragraph: Narrow insurance networks are not the problem. The problem is that not all networks are of high enough quality.

headline.main: In Health Care, Choice Is Overrated
headline.print_headline: In Health Care, Choice Is Overrated

docs.abstract: Ezekiel J Emanuel Op-Ed article holds, contrary to popular opinion, having broad range of doctors to choose from under insurance plan is overrated; suggests quality of doctors available is more important than quantity; maintains patients can receive good care under Affordable Care Act's narrow network bronze health plan as long as quality and safety standards are enforced.
docs.snippet: Narrow insurance networks are not the problem. The problem is that not all networks are of high enough quality.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The action helps Democrats in tight midterm election races, because it avoids the election-year cancellation of insurance policies that do not comply with the new health law.

headline.main: Consumers Allowed to Keep Health Plans for Two More Years
headline.print_headline: Some Policies Get More Time in Health Shift

docs.abstract: Obama administration says it will allow consumers to renew health insurance policies that do not comply with the new health care law for two more years, pushing issue well beyond 2014 midterm elections; action reflects difficulty Pres Obama has faced in trying to build support for the Affordable Care Act amid uproar over his overstated pledge that people who liked their insurance plans could keep them, no matter what.
docs.snippet: The action helps Democrats in tight midterm election races, because it avoids the election-year cancellation of insurance policies that do not comply with the new health law.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration on Wednesday said it would allow health insurers to extend plans that fail to comply with its signature health law for an additional two years, a move Republicans quickly condemned as a politically motivated delay.
